pros: Chill environment Supportive boss Flexible schedule Mostly easy tasks Opportunity to also work in the summer

- The administration is friendly
- Plenty of Holidays
- Snow days are amazing
cons:
The pay is not competitive, and asking for a raise is just laughed at you also will be taken advantage of if you work too hard.

If you have a family the health insurance is going to cost you $1000/month to insure your dependants.

pros: Small town, great people, good pay
cons: Small town, same people, nothing to do

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Alva, OK
pros: Flexible for personal schedule and department head helped schedule classes around my personal schedule.
cons: Low pay, not any motivation to increase pay, administration rejected any consideration for pay increase. Left and doubled my salary in one year in private sector.

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Alva, OK
pros: Support for personal and family responsibilities
cons: Low pay, no executive leadership, micro-management from administration, low academic standards, no financial support for student extracurricular activities

review_title: Gotta join a click to fit
job_title: Assistant Athletic Director for Communications in Alva, OK
pros: Small staff, friendly, very small town
cons: Expected to build a bridge with a hand full of sand. The town is stuck in the 80s.

review_title: A rewarding experience that I wouldn't change.
pros: Excellent benefits. Right off the bat you get several weeks of paid vacation and based on your work experience you accrued hours off and sick leave every month. Easy place to work and most of the people are very good to work with.
cons: The salary is incredibly low compared to comparable positions. Annualized raises are all but nonexistent. Can be difficult to get a promotion.

review_title: Northwestern has done nothing but support me and help me to enhance myself as an employee and as a person.
job_title: Director of Student Success and Counseling in Alva, OK
pros: The staff, working with students, flexibility, and great supervisors. I love the fact that I get to work with students.
cons: Rural area and the pay is not competitive. Due to budget cuts, many times a person will get multiple job duties.

review_title: Great opportunity for a student who is wanting to learn how to run a gym.
pros: I love the atmosphere. Getting to be around people everyday is just something that I love.
cons: I have none for this job.

pros: The people are amazing and very down to earth. Time off is easily attainable.
cons: As a student, we are subjected to federal minimum wage which unfortunately is $7.25

pros: Short week during the summer, Good camaraderie among employees, True Collegiate atmosphere
cons: Very small town, Not much opportunity for growth in this position, State funded

job_title: Student Worker in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Its a very nice working environment.
cons: Their isn't enough available working hours.
